head.title: VisualDCT Release Notes

modification.section: Package C (full graphical hierarchy support) release candidate.

head.scope: This document is contains release notes of the current build.
head.audience: The audience of this document are all users of this VisualDCT build.

section.title: Release Notes
section.p:
Changes in current version:
An invalid link can be displayed as a link because VDCT appears to be case-insensitive even though EPICS requires field names to be upper-case
A minor problem: VME_IO I/O fields are required to have a trailing @ parameter according to VDCT. e.g. it demands an address #C0 S0 @ rather than #C0 S0.
VAL field is always shown in inspector (some DBD do not have prompt_gui defined).
This is really important - novices can easily overwrite a .dbd file because VDCT always seems to take the last used file extension as the default. So the first save operation of your new .db file will attempt to overwrite the .dbd file you have just opened, by default.
fixed VAL -> VAL linking - should not be possible
links starting with digits are not assumed to be constant links anymore, only if records does not exists

Disabilities/missing:
include statement is implemented, but saving files containing include statements will also include all the content of includes files.
multiple template definitions in one DB are not supported
user's manual to be completed

Still there are quite a lot of ideas and nice features to be implemeted in the next releases:
search for objects
record morphing
pop-up menu for commonly used commands on objects
...
